name: Tunes & Tales: Toronto Northern Lights & Sandra Whiting
description:
Embark on a colourful journey every Friday at Old City Hall, where musicians perform from the grand staircase and storytellers fill the council chamber with lively tales that celebrate Toronto's vibrant cultural mosaic. Enjoy soulful tunes, festive melodies and stirring stories with a global flavour that capture the magic of the season. 

This event features energetic performances by Toronto Northern Lights, the city's top acapella chorus, along with storytelling by Sandra Whiting, who inspires audiences with her passion and humour.

name: Oriental Legend Toronto Show

location.name: The Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre

description:
Toronto audiences are set for a breathtaking cultural event this holiday season as the internationally acclaimed dance drama Oriental Legend makes its long-awaited Canadian debut! 

This award-winning production blends dazzling choreography, cinematic stagecraft, and a soul-stirring narrative to deliver an unforgettable night of beauty and emotion in the heart of downtown Toronto.

Set in the ancient Silk Road city of Jingjue, Oriental Legend tells an epic story of courage, friendship, and unity. Beyond its artistry, this is history to life, audiences are invited to discover ancient relics, imperial aesthetics, and the cultural spirit of the Western Regions. 

It is not only a milestone in cultural exchange but also a luminous addition to the city's festive performing-arts rotation.

name: LOCAL SOUL: A Small Biz Holiday Market
description:
Toronto's neighbourhood shops have taken real hits this year and LOCAL SOUL is giving them a true comeback moment. Hosted by Soul Provisions, this two-day holiday market brings together former storefront owners, emerging makers and online-only creators for an in-person, community-driven shopping experience.

Expect handcrafted gifts, food, art, and thoughtful goods from a lineup of entirely women-owned businesses, plus free soup for shoppers and free popsicles for kids! All Soul Provisions products (soups, stocks, dips, baguettes, coffee beans & more) will be 15% off, with purchases supporting the Toronto Soup Co's 2026 Soup Empathy Project.

Featuring vendors from: @strand, @thegreenjarshop, @kimsmiley, @bunnyroo_inc, @drawmeamonster, @thefoundgeneral, @withgracemarketplace, @source.organics, @gemmiesgirlsjewelry, @miniforher

Plus new goods now carried by Soul Provisions: @brinedcanada, @soulchocolate, @drinksollys, @drinkbarbet, @ezras.toronto, @davesgenuine.deli, @harbordbakeryto,

name: Riverside Antler Breakfast - Annual Fundraiser
description:
An annual festive community fundraiser and celebration, in support of a great local cause. 

Now in its 14th year, this annual event is taking place in support of Mustard Seed and Ralph Thornton Community Centre programming.

Enjoy a delicious holiday buffet breakfast, festive programming, entertainment, and bid on silent auction items from local businesses. You can also opt to make a donation online, donate a silent auction item or become a sponsor - there are many ways to support and it's all for a good local cause!

name: Isaac Mizrahi: A Holiday Fruitcake

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Acclaimed by the New York Times as "a founding father of a genre that fuses performance art, music and stand-up comedy." 

Actor, host, writer, designer, and producer, the inimitable Isaac Mizrahi brings his signature blend of storytelling, song, and sharp-witted humour to Toronto. A name synonymous with high fashion, Mizrahi brings glitz, glam, and runway magic straight to the cabaret, showcasing his talents as a glamorous chanteur extraordinaire. 

Hailed by The New York Times as "determined to challenge the cultural status quo," Mizrahi is as bold and brilliant as ever. Whether you are a devoted fan or discovering his artistry for the first time, this is an evening not to be missed.

name: Santa & Mrs. Claus Photo Op
description: Snap a selfie with Santa and Mrs. Claus as they stop by Old City Hall on their way to the North Pole. Whether you've been naughty or nice, everyone is welcome to join in the fun. Bring your own camera or device and share some holiday cheer this festive season. Suitable for all ages.

name: Christmas with Dala
description:
JUNO Award nominees and winners of the 2010 Canadian Folk Music Award for Vocal Group of the Year, Amanda Walther and Sheila Carabine of Dala write and sing in harmony best described as angelic. 

These two best friends met in their high school music class in 2002. They have since released five albums and toured extensively across North America. 

Darlings of the Canadian music scene, Dala are now poised to bring their fresh brand of acoustic pop music to the world.

name: Waleed Kush Afro-Jazz
description:
Combining the impelling ancient rhythms of Africa with exhilarating, modern jazz improvisations. From Nubia, Sudan, to Harlem and Toronto.

Their rhythms are played in what is considered "odd time" in Western music, combining jazz chord progressions with traditional African rhythms to produce an entrancing experience.

Waleed tells stories atop an imaginative musical landscape, inspired by the chanting and vocal phrasing which have accompanied these rhythms since ancient times. Each composition narrates an experience or journey, continually changing depending on what story the musicians want to tell. 

Sometimes these experiences are personal, sometimes they are historical, sometimes they are a retelling of the past of the Nile and Nubian pyramids. Each musical journey creates a relationship between the band and the audience. Waleed sings in over 15 African and Western languages, celebrating the African diaspora in Canada.

name: Kirtan and Sacred Song Ceremony
description:
Join VJ, Madison, and Taylor of Velvet Om for an unforgettable evening of music, prayer, and community.

Together, we'll sing, chant, and embrace the energy and spirit of unconditional Love. No experience is needed, just an open heart! Come, connect and let the music carry us all to a place of warmth and harmony.

Bring your heart, your voice, and maybe a blanket. Let's meet where music meets the ocean, and community becomes family.

name: The Sattalites
description:
An influential Canadian reggae band and the winners of two Juno Awards. 

Come out and listen!

name: Max Forster
description: Max Forster is a longtime member of the Drom community, who you may have seen with Lemon Bucket Orkestra, Queen Kong, Glava Lava, or the Toronto Klezmer Society.

name: Indigenous Cultural Competency Learning Event
description:
For the first time, the Nbisiing Indigenous Cultural Competency Learning is now available to individual learners.

 Whether you are an interested, motivated member of the public, or you work in the Indigenous space, this course is for you.

The course is designed to build cultural competency and introduce concepts of cultural safety in working with First Nations, MÃ©tis and Inuit, and becoming a better ally in support of Truth and Reconciliation.

This course meets the requirements of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC) Calls to Action No. 57 and 93 (iii).

name: Community Dinner Around Storytelling with Shelly Grace
description:
Ancestral knowledge, intergenerational relationships, and kin-focused narratives in community are necessary to maintain and protect communities and their collectively held knowledge. Join community dinner gatherings to discuss and share your knowledge about how people in Kingston-Galloway/Orton Park (KGO) share stories between elders and youth, neighbors, chosen family and friend groups. Both dinners will enable community members to meet, eat, and discuss practices that are necessary for the survival of our stories. Free dinner is provided for attendees.

A City of Toronto Cultural Hotspot Ignite initiative.

name: Hot Goss
description:
We're taking the hot gossip offline and onto a stage with your favourite comedians!

From the producer behind your favourite sold-out shows, comes a brand-new live experience where comedy meets the juiciest gossip.

Do you have a hilarious rumour, or confessional? We want to hear it! Submit your gossip anonymously  - you might just see your story on stage.

Featuring award winning comedians Adrienne Fish, Brandon Ash-Mohammed, Faiza Kulle, Orion Candelma and Tamara Shevon. Hosted and produced by Anasimone.
